decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and card draw to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for explosive plays using cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of powerful cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Bolas's Citadel provides additional win conditions and versatility. Overall, the deck aims to assemble a powerful combination of cards to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single turn.

The main idea of this deck is to aggressively use cards that allow for efficient plays and disruption, while taking advantage of cards that can be played for free or at a reduced cost. The core strategy revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with creatures like Hollow One and Vengevine by utilizing effects like Bazaar of Baghdad. This allows for explosive starts and puts pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap to protect its game plan and shut down opposing strategies.

This deck focuses on aggressive early plays with creatures like Vengevine and Hollow One while utilizing Bazaar of Baghdad to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Squee, Goblin Nabob and Basking Rootwalla. The deck also runs disruption in the form of Force of Will, Mindbreak Trap, and Misdirection to protect its key threats and keep the opponent off-balance. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy with cards like Gaea's Cradle and Wasteland to ramp up and disrupt the opponent's resources.

This Vintage Doomsday combo deck focuses on using cards like Doomsday, Necropotence, and tutors to set up a winning combo with Thassa's Oracle. The deck aims to quickly assemble its key pieces, protect its combo with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, and efficiently dig for its combo pieces with cantrips and card draw spells. It also utilizes rituals and fast mana like Dark Ritual and Black Lotus to accelerate its game plan and win the game quickly before opponents can disrupt its strategy.

This deck is focused on utilizing the Dark Depths combo to win the game. It includes various pieces like Thespian's Stage, Helm of Obedience, and Leyline of the Void to create a powerful board state and prevent opponent's strategies. The deck also includes mana acceleration cards like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb to quickly get the necessary resources. To disrupt opponents and slow down their plans, the deck includes cards like Sphere of Resistance and Sorcerous Spyglass. Overall, the key concept is to assemble the Dark Depths combo and control the game through disrupting opponent's strategies.

This deck focuses on generating card advantage through efficient card draw spells and card selection, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic and removal spells. The goal is to control the game tempo and gradually overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Monastery Mentor. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging the flexibility of Jeskai colors, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victories through a combination of aggression and careful decision-making.

This deck aims to utilize the powerful combo potential of Underworld Breach alongside various card advantage engines and tutors to quickly assemble a winning board state. With efficient mana acceleration and disruption spells like Force of Will, the deck aims to outpace and overwhelm opponents, while also utilizing a toolbox of powerful singleton spells to adapt to different matchups. By combining graveyard recursion with powerful spells like Tinker and Bolas's Citadel, the deck can quickly generate a dominant position and close out games before opponents have a chance to respond effectively.

The deck revolves around leveraging powerful spells and card advantage to set up the combo with Underworld Breach, using the graveyard as a resource to repeatedly cast spells from exile. The deck also includes disruptive elements like counterspells and removal to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Key cards like Brain Freeze and Managorger Hydra can be used to win the game once the combo is set up. The mana base is designed to provide the colors necessary to cast the spells in the deck efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to create powerful combo plays by casting spells from the graveyard, supported by cards like Brain Freeze, Gush, and Dig Through Time. It aims to control the game with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm while also generating card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor. The deck can also play aggressively with cards like Monastery Mentor and Lightning Bolt. The mana acceleration provided by Moxen and Black Lotus allows for explosive plays, while the versatile land base ensures consistent mana access.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible using cards like Crop Rotation and Thespian's Stage, supported by cards like Fastbond and Life from the Loam to accelerate the process. It also includes disruptive elements like Sphere of Resistance and Deafening Silence to slow down the opponent and protect the combo. Additionally, cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter help deal with the opponent's key lands. The deck aims to consistently and efficiently execute the combo while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure victory.

This deck focuses on creating a winning combo by using Doomsday to stack the deck in a specific order, allowing the player to draw and play the necessary cards to win the game in a single turn. The deck includes powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo, along with tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to search for combo pieces. Additional card draw spells and cantrips help the player dig through their deck quickly to find the combo pieces needed to execute the win condition.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The key strategy involves using cards like Dark Ritual and Demonic Tutor to quickly find and cast Doomsday, then using it to set up a winning pile of cards with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes a variety of card draw and counterspells to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. The goal is to execute the combo as efficiently and effectively as possible to secure victory.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly and efficiently through artifacts like Mana Crypt, Mana Vault, and Moxen, while using cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Bolas's Citadel to combo off and draw through the deck, finding key pieces like Tinker to fetch powerful win conditions. Control elements like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler help protect the combo, while disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade can slow down opponents. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost spells and countering opponent's threats while generating card advantage. It utilizes powerful cards like Monastery Mentor, Snapcaster Mage, and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to create a fast and aggressive game plan. The deck also leverages efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Pyroblast to control the game and protect its threats. By utilizing mana accelerants like Moxen and powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells while maintaining a strong position on the board.

This Merfolk deck focuses on using disruptive creatures like Unsettled Mariner and Cursecatcher, combined with powerful lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to apply early pressure and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Null Rod to protect its creatures and slow down the opponent's game plan. With a mix of creatures, disruption, and tempo plays, this deck aims to quickly establish board presence and maintain control of the game until victory.

This deck aims to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent by efficiently deploying threats and disrupting their game plan with countermagic and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board early on and then use its card draw and card selection spells to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent. Narset, Parter of Veils and Dack Fayden provide additional card advantage and disruption, while the creatures, such as Dreadhorde Arcanist and Sprite Dragon, serve as threats that can quickly end the game. The mana base is optimized for consistent and powerful early plays.
